meanings.definition: A family of cell surface receptors that mediate cell-cell and cell-matrix adhesion.
meanings.sent1: The integrins on the cell surface help cells stick together.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study integrins to understand how cells connect to each other.
meanings.sent3: The integrins at the party made sure everyone stayed close together.
meanings.sent4: Like glue, integrins hold cells in place like a strong bond.
meanings.sent5: Imagine integrins as tiny hands that grab onto other cells tightly.

meanings.definition: Proteins that play a crucial role in cell signaling and cell adhesion processes.
meanings.sent1: Doctors are researching how integrins affect cell communication.
meanings.sent2: Integrins are essential for cells to stick to their surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The integrins in the play were the messengers between the cells.
meanings.sent4: In the dance of life, integrins are the choreographers of cell movements.
meanings.sent5: Visualize integrins as the conductors orchestrating cell interactions.
